title: SB 1325
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The department reviews and approves plans for compliance with regulations and state/federal laws. Approval is delayed until certain conditions are met, including approval from the Water Code or if immediate action is needed for public health or safety. The department imposes hazardous waste facility postclosure plan requirements on owners/operators through enforcement orders, agreements, or permits, subject to public involvement and compliance with the California Environmental Quality Act. The department determines significant modifications based on class 3 permit criteria and public concern. This does not limit the department's authority to protect public health and safety at facilities. The department has the authority to order actions to protect public health and safety at facilities. If a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan is imposed through an enforcement order or agreement, the owner/operator must pay specified fees. The department can enforce the postclosure plan through various actions under state law. The department can take action to enforce postclosure plans at hazardous waste facilities, including filing actions to enjoin violations, requiring corrective measures, and assessing civil penalties. Regulations for postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by January 1, 2018. The department must adopt regulations by January 1, 2018, to impose postclosure plan requirements. If necessary, a postclosure permit can replace an enforcement order or agreement. The department retains authority to order actions for public health and safety. Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to outline the approval process for submitted plans. The department must approve the plan within 60 days of submission for an interim status facility, unless immediate approval is needed for public health or safety. The department can impose postclosure plan requirements on a hazardous waste facility owner through enforcement orders, agreements, or permits. The hazardous waste facility postclosure plan must be approved in compliance with the California Environmental Quality Act. The department must provide a meaningful opportunity for public involvement before approving or modifying the plan. (C) A "significant modification" is determined by the department based on whether it would be classified as a class 3 permit modification for hazardous waste facilities. Factors considered include similarity to class 3 modifications in regulations and public concern. The department can still take immediate action to protect public health and safety. If the department imposes a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan in the form of an enforcement order or enforceable agreement, the owner or operator must enter into a cost reimbursement agreement and pay the required fee. The department may take actions such as filing an injunction to enforce the postclosure plan. The department can take various actions to enforce a hazardous waste facility postclosure plan, including filing an injunction, requiring compliance with corrective actions, and assessing civil penalties for violations. Additionally, regulations for postclosure plan requirements must be adopted by January 1, 2018. The department must adopt regulations by January 1, 2018, to impose postclosure plan requirements. If deemed necessary, the department can replace an enforcement order with a postclosure permit for a hazardous waste facility. This section does not limit the department's authority to take actions to protect public health, safety, or the environment. Section 1.5 of the bill includes amendments to Section 25247 of the Health and Safety Code, contingent on the enactment of Assembly Bill 1611 or Senate Bill 839 by January 1, 2017. If this bill is enacted last, it will override the amendments made by the other bills.
